snippet: Los Angeles defeated the Rangers in the Stanley Cup finals to lift the Cup for the second time in three years, an achievement that comes despite the current salary-capped era of parity in the N.H.L.
abstract: One team winning two Stanley Cups in three seasons during this salary-capped era of parity in the NHL defies logic, but Los Angeles Kings have never paid mind to expectations of others; franchise captured its first championship in 2012, and in 2014 they defeated New York Rangers to again hoist one of the most recognizable trophies in sports.
lead_paragraph: Los Angeles defeated the Rangers in the Stanley Cup finals to lift the Cup for the second time in three years, an achievement that comes despite the current salary-capped era of parity in the N.H.L.

headline.main: Kings’ Second Stanley Cup in Three Seasons Defies Cap Logic
headline.print_headline: Kings’ Second Cup in Three Seasons Defies Cap Logic
